dict.string: Find and process new macro groups
SELECT grn.Group_Name FROM groups_new grn LEFT JOIN groups_old gro ON grn.Group_ID = gro.Group_ID WHERE gro.Group_ID IS NULL
Update datatbase if there were matches
Set the status of the new groups in the database
UPDATE groups_new SET Group_Status = 'new' WHERE Group_ID IN ( SELECT grn.Group_ID FROM groups_new grn LEFT JOIN groups_old gro ON grn.Group_ID = gro.Group_ID WHERE gro.Group_ID IS NULL )

array.string: Set status of new macro groups

dict.string: +Extract new macro groups and update database
Make sure there are things to label before labeling
Empty macro groups have UUIDs but don't exist in Finder, so skip them
If folder exists and labels enabled, apply labels
Extract the new macros from the database
SELECT mn.Macro_Name, mn.Group_Name FROM macros_new mn LEFT JOIN macros_old mo ON mn.Macro_ID = mo.Macro_ID WHERE mo.Macro_ID IS NULL
Make sure there are matches before trying to update database
Set the status of the new macros to 'new'
UPDATE macros_new SET Macro_Status='new' WHERE Macro_ID IN ( SELECT mn.Macro_ID FROM macros_new mn LEFT JOIN macros_old mo ON mn.Macro_ID = mo.Macro_ID WHERE mo.Macro_ID IS NULL )
Extract new macros and update database
Make sure there are things to do before proceeding
Extract macros groups with new macros that are not new macro groups
SELECT DISTINCT gn.Group_Name FROM groups_new gn WHERE gn.Group_Status <> 'new' AND gn.Group_ID IN ( SELECT mn.Group_ID FROM macros_new mn WHERE mn.Macro_Status='new' )

array.string: Extract macro groups with new macros that aren't new macro groups

dict.string: Mark the modified groups as such in the database
UPDATE groups_new SET Group_Status = 'modified' WHERE Group_Status <> 'new' AND Group_ID IN ( SELECT mn.Group_ID FROM macros_new mn WHERE mn.Macro_Status='new' )
Update dabase for new macros and groups with new macros in them
Get list of deleted macro groups
Extract deleted groups from the database
SELECT gro.Group_Name FROM groups_old gro LEFT JOIN groups_new grn ON gro.Group_ID = grn.Group_ID WHERE grn.Group_ID IS NULL
Set the status of the deleted groups in the old database
UPDATE groups_old SET Group_Status = 'deleted' WHERE Group_ID NOT IN (SELECT Group_ID FROM groups_new)
Extract deleted macro groups and update database
Extract a list of deleted macros from the database
SELECT mo.Macro_Name, mo.Group_Name FROM macros_old mo LEFT JOIN macros_new mn ON mo.Macro_ID = mn.Macro_ID WHERE mn.Macro_ID IS NULL;
Set the status of the deleted macros in the old database
UPDATE macros_old SET Macro_Status = 'deleted' WHERE Macro_ID NOT IN (SELECT Macro_ID FROM macros_new)
Extract deleted macros and update database
Identify and process identical macro groups
Extract a list of groups that do not have a status set but exist in old and new
Select only groups with identical names and IDs and no status in newest backup
SELECT grn.Group_Name FROM groups_new grn JOIN groups_old gro ON grn.Group_ID = gro.Group_ID WHERE (grn.Group_Status IS NULL OR grn.Group_Status = '') AND grn.Group_Name = gro.Group_Name;

array.string: Extract groups with identical names/IDs and no status in new backup

dict.string: Only process if we have matches
Find and process (add to list, label, and hard link) identical groups
Set full path to macro group in newest backup
Set full path to macro group in older backup
Diff them; if no diff, then save group name to var
If no diff, process identical group
Add it to the list of identical groups
If enabled, convert to hard links

This step should be simpler: cp -al should just copy everything as a hard link, but it throws an assertion failed error.
In 13.6, it still works, but it breaks in 14. The workaround is this, to select all in each folder with ln. It works, but feels less elegant.
Remove blank lines from identical group list
Format data for database update, and update database
Mark the identical groups in the database
UPDATE groups_new SET Group_Status = 'identical' WHERE (Group_Name) IN (%Variable%instance_identicalGroupsForDB%)
Mark the identical macros within the identical groups in the database
UPDATE macros_new SET Macro_Status = 'identical' WHERE (Group_Name) IN (%Variable%instance_identicalGroupsForDB%)

array.string: Set status of identical macros within identical groups

dict.string: Unprotect the apostrophes before using again
Update database for identical macros and groups
no identical groups ... need to do something here but what?

dict.string: No identical macro groups to process
Report: Prepare header for new/deleted groups section
Report: Prepare header for identical groups section
(Macros are hard linked to prior backup)
